table.style: border: 0px; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;

tr.style: border: 1px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;
border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Use to record detailed information about conditions, problems or diagnoses recognized by a clinician. There are many uses including: recording a Diagnosis during an Encounter; populating a problem List or a Summary Statement, such as a Discharge Summary.

tr.td: Detailed information about conditions, problems or diagnoses

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: This records identifiers associated with this condition that are defined by business processed and/ or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Indicates the patient who the condition record is associated with.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Encounter during which the condition was first asserted.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Person who takes responsibility for asserting the existence of the condition as part of the electronic record.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Estimated or actual date the condition/problem/diagnosis was first detected/suspected.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.

tr.td:
Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis
ConditionKind (??)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A category assigned to the condition. E.g. complaint | symptom | finding | diagnosis.

tr.td:
E.g. complaint | symptom | finding | diagnosis
ConditionCategory (??)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The clinical status of the condition.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The degree of confidence that this condition is correct.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Estimated or actual date the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

tr.td: Estimated or actual date, or age

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A date, or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). There is no time zone. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth and date. Dates SHALL be valid dates.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A date, or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). There is no time zone. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth and date. Dates SHALL be valid dates.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Value of "true" or "false"

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments.

tr.td:
Stage/grade, usually assessed formally
Stage SHALL have summary or assessment

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A simple summary of the stage such as "Stage 3". The determination of the stage is disease-specific.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Reference to a formal record of the evidence on which the staging assessment is based.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Supporting Evidence / manifestations that are the basis on which this condition is suspected or confirmed.

tr.td:
Supporting evidence
evidence SHALL have code or details

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A manifestation or symptom that led to the recording of this condition.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Links to other relevant information, including pathology reports.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.

tr.td:
Anatomical location, if relevant
location SHALL have code or details

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Code that identifies the structural location.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Detailed anatomical location information.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Further conditions, problems, diagnoses, procedures or events that are related in some way to this condition, or the substance that caused/triggered this Condition.

tr.td:
Causes or precedents for this Condition
Relationship SHALL have either a code or a target

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The type of relationship that this condition has to the related item.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Code that identifies the target of this relationship. The code takes the place of a detailed instance target.

tr.td:
Relationship target by means of a predefined code
ConditionKind (??)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Target of the relationship.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAD0lEQVR42mP4TzJgIF0LANmXY523xFiMAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Additional information about the Condition. This is a general notes/comments entry for description of the Condition, its diagnosis and prognosis.

purpose.value: This is the definition for the Condition resource

short.value: Detailed information about conditions, problems or diagnoses

formal.value: Use to record detailed information about conditions, problems or diagnoses recognized by a clinician. There are many uses including: recording a Diagnosis during an Encounter; populating a problem List or a Summary Statement, such as a Discharge Summary.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: The base language in which the resource is written.

comments.value:
Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource
Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

short.value: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

formal.value: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

comments.value: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

formal.value: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

comments.value: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

formal.value: This records identifiers associated with this condition that are defined by business processed and/ or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).
Indicates the patient who the condition record is associated with.
Encounter during which the condition was first asserted.
Person who takes responsibility for asserting the existence of the condition as part of the electronic record.
Estimated or actual date the condition/problem/diagnosis was first detected/suspected.

short.value: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis

formal.value: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.

description.value: Identification of the Condition or diagnosis.

formal.value: A category assigned to the condition. E.g. complaint | symptom | finding | diagnosis.

comments.value: The categorization is often highly contextual and may appear poorly differentiated or not very useful in other contexts.

description.value: A category assigned to the condition. E.g. finding | Condition | diagnosis | concern | condition

map.value: 'problem' if from PRB-3. 'diagnosis' if from DG1 segment in PV1 message

formal.value: The clinical status of the condition.

description.value: The clinical status of the Condition or diagnosis

map.value:
.code (pre or post-coordinated in)
Can use valueNegationInd for refuted

formal.value: The degree of confidence that this condition is correct.

comments.value: May be a percentage.

description.value: The degree of confidence that this condition is correct

formal.value: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

comments.value: Coding of the severity with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

description.value: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

map.value: Can be pre/post-coordinated into value. Or ./inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ].source[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN, code="severity"].value

short.value: Estimated or actual date, or age

formal.value: Estimated or actual date the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

comments.value: Age is generally used when the patient reports an age at which the Condition began to occur.

formal.value: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

comments.value:
There is no explicit distinction between resolution and remission because in many cases the distinction is not clear. Age is generally used when the patient reports an age at which the Condition abated.
If there is no abatement element, it is unknown whether the condition has resolved or entered remission; applications and users should generally assume that the condition is still valid.

map.value: .effectiveTime.high or .inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ].source[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN, code="age at remission"].value or .inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ]source[classCode=CONC, moodCode=EVN].status=completed

formal.value: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments.

human.value: Stage SHALL have summary or assessment

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: A simple summary of the stage such as "Stage 3". The determination of the stage is disease-specific.
Reference to a formal record of the evidence on which the staging assessment is based.
Supporting Evidence / manifestations that are the basis on which this condition is suspected or confirmed.

comments.value: The evidence may be a simple list of coded symptoms/manifestations, or references to observations or formal assessments, or both.

human.value: evidence SHALL have code or details

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: A manifestation or symptom that led to the recording of this condition.
Links to other relevant information, including pathology reports.
The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.

comments.value: May be a summary code, or a reference to a very precise definition of the location, or both.

human.value: location SHALL have code or details

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: Code that identifies the structural location.

comments.value: May include laterality.

formal.value: Detailed anatomical location information.

short.value: Causes or precedents for this Condition

formal.value: Further conditions, problems, diagnoses, procedures or events that are related in some way to this condition, or the substance that caused/triggered this Condition.

comments.value: Although a condition may be caused by a substance, this is not intended to be used to record allergies/adverse reactions to substances.

human.value: Relationship SHALL have either a code or a target

map.value: could infer from presence of multiple PRB segments in a PPR message that the problems are related, but not clear how to communicate the nature of the relationship

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. formal.value: The type of relationship that this condition has to the related item.

description.value: The type of relationship between a condition and its related item

short.value: Relationship target by means of a predefined code

formal.value: Code that identifies the target of this relationship. The code takes the place of a detailed instance target.

description.value: Identification of the Condition or diagnosis.

formal.value: Target of the relationship.
Additional information about the Condition. This is a general notes/comments entry for description of the Condition, its diagnosis and prognosis.

short.value: Detailed information about conditions, problems or diagnoses

formal.value: Use to record detailed information about conditions, problems or diagnoses recognized by a clinician. There are many uses including: recording a Diagnosis during an Encounter; populating a problem List or a Summary Statement, such as a Discharge Summary.

This records identifiers associated with this condition that are defined by business processed and/ or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).
Indicates the patient who the condition record is associated with.
Encounter during which the condition was first asserted.
Person who takes responsibility for asserting the existence of the condition as part of the electronic record.
Estimated or actual date the condition/problem/diagnosis was first detected/suspected.

short.value: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis

formal.value: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.

description.value: Identification of the Condition or diagnosis.

formal.value: A category assigned to the condition. E.g. complaint | symptom | finding | diagnosis.

comments.value: The categorization is often highly contextual and may appear poorly differentiated or not very useful in other contexts.

description.value: A category assigned to the condition. E.g. finding | Condition | diagnosis | concern | condition

map.value: 'problem' if from PRB-3. 'diagnosis' if from DG1 segment in PV1 message

formal.value: The clinical status of the condition.

description.value: The clinical status of the Condition or diagnosis

map.value:
.code (pre or post-coordinated in)
Can use valueNegationInd for refuted

formal.value: The degree of confidence that this condition is correct.

comments.value: May be a percentage.

description.value: The degree of confidence that this condition is correct

formal.value: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

comments.value: Coding of the severity with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

description.value: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

map.value: Can be pre/post-coordinated into value. Or ./inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ].source[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN, code="severity"].value

short.value: Estimated or actual date, or age

formal.value: Estimated or actual date the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

comments.value: Age is generally used when the patient reports an age at which the Condition began to occur.

formal.value: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

comments.value:
There is no explicit distinction between resolution and remission because in many cases the distinction is not clear. Age is generally used when the patient reports an age at which the Condition abated.
If there is no abatement element, it is unknown whether the condition has resolved or entered remission; applications and users should generally assume that the condition is still valid.

map.value: .effectiveTime.high or .inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ].source[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN, code="age at remission"].value or .inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ]source[classCode=CONC, moodCode=EVN].status=completed

formal.value: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments.

human.value: Stage SHALL have summary or assessment

formal.value: A simple summary of the stage such as "Stage 3". The determination of the stage is disease-specific.
Reference to a formal record of the evidence on which the staging assessment is based.
Supporting Evidence / manifestations that are the basis on which this condition is suspected or confirmed.

comments.value: The evidence may be a simple list of coded symptoms/manifestations, or references to observations or formal assessments, or both.

human.value: evidence SHALL have code or details

formal.value: A manifestation or symptom that led to the recording of this condition.
Links to other relevant information, including pathology reports.
The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.

comments.value: May be a summary code, or a reference to a very precise definition of the location, or both.

human.value: location SHALL have code or details

formal.value: Code that identifies the structural location.

comments.value: May include laterality.

formal.value: Detailed anatomical location information.

short.value: Causes or precedents for this Condition

formal.value: Further conditions, problems, diagnoses, procedures or events that are related in some way to this condition, or the substance that caused/triggered this Condition.

comments.value: Although a condition may be caused by a substance, this is not intended to be used to record allergies/adverse reactions to substances.

human.value: Relationship SHALL have either a code or a target

map.value: could infer from presence of multiple PRB segments in a PPR message that the problems are related, but not clear how to communicate the nature of the relationship

formal.value: The type of relationship that this condition has to the related item.

description.value: The type of relationship between a condition and its related item

short.value: Relationship target by means of a predefined code

formal.value: Code that identifies the target of this relationship. The code takes the place of a detailed instance target.

description.value: Identification of the Condition or diagnosis.

formal.value: Target of the relationship.
Additional information about the Condition. This is a general notes/comments entry for description of the Condition, its diagnosis and prognosis.

The stated language of the resource
